You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
CC Admin Global Settings

Global settings include data management tools for admins and some Salesforce custom settings that apply to all of your storefronts.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Data Loader
Load JSON-formatted static resources that specify global or storefront-specific configuration settings, Salesforce custom settings, and custom object records.
For global settings, when you set up B2B Commerce for Visualforce for the first time, you load a static resource that specifies global configuration data and custom settings. When you upgrade to a new version of the B2B Commerce managed package, including patch releases, use Data Loader to upgrade the global configuration data and custom settings.
For storefront-specific settings, you load a second static resource that specifies configuration data and custom settings for a uniquely named store. When you first set up B2B Commerce for Visualforce, you load data for the DefaultStore. You can choose a default data set that B2B Commerce provides, or you can load storefront data from your own JSON static resource.
Settings
Configure the following values that impact all storefronts:
The account name for anonymous users. B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses this account to determine pricing and product entitlements for users who browse your storefronts without logging in. For more information, see Allow a B2B Commerce for Visualforce Guest Buyer to Browse Your Storefront.
The name of the default storefront, which B2B Commerce for Visualforce falls back to when it can’t determine which storefront to display for the user. For more information, see Rename, Copy, or Delete a Storefront.
The logging token to use for troubleshooting or debugging B2B Commerce for Visualforce code execution from your browser console window. For more information, see Log Storefront Code Execution.
NOTE Leave Enable sObject Config Settings checked. This option is available only for compatibility when upgrading from CloudCraze 4.3 or earlier to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or earlier. See Migrate to sObject Considerations.
You can also clear the platform cache.
Indexing
Refresh the cached or indexed data for products, categories, menus, page labels, and the site index.
Page Keys
See the list of key values for the default storefront pages that B2B Commerce for Visualforce installs. Use a page key value when you change configuration settings for a particular page.
Storefronts
View a list of all storefronts and rename, clone, delete, or create a storefront.
Configuration Cache Management
Build, activate, or deactivate a cache of configuration settings. Each configuration cache includes settings for all of your storefronts, even though you often manage configuration settings at the storefront level.
Configuration Modules
Add, delete, or modify configuration modules and metadata for individual configuration settings, such as setting names and descriptions. The global static resource you load when you set up B2B Commerce for Visualforce for the first time specifies the default modules and settings.
Configuration Settings
Specify values for configuration settings that apply to all storefronts. The default values are specified in the global static resource you load when you set up B2B Commerce for Visualforce for the first time. You can override a global setting on a specific storefront by changing the value in the storefront’s configuration settings.
Settings Loader
Download Salesforce custom settings records for B2B Commerce for Visualforce in CSV format, or upload your own CSV file with new records. These tools are helpful when you’re migrating data between orgs.
Load Storefront Data from a Static Resource
To easily add custom object records, custom settings, and configuration metadata for a storefront to your org, you can create and load a static resource. You can define all the storefront data that you want to load, or supplement existing data with more records.
Rename, Copy, or Delete a Storefront
View a list of all your storefronts and easily rename, clone, delete, or create a storefront.
Refresh a Data Index or Cache
To improve storefront performance, B2B Commerce for Visualforce caches configuration data for products, categories, menus, page labels, and your site index. Whenever you modify records that affect this data, manually refresh the associated index or cache to reflect the changes on your storefront.
Update Global Custom Settings Records for Your Storefronts
Certain custom settings that apply to all storefronts are created when you install B2B Commerce for Visualforce. Salesforce doesn’t provide a UI for managing these settings because they generally remain unchanged. However, you can update the settings if necessary by downloading the record definitions in CSV format and then uploading your modified data. Manage country and currency codes, page section definitions, service extension definitions, and more.
